books.title: The Eleventh Virgin
books.author: Dorothy Day
books.summary: A young radical journalist has a love affair in New York in the 1910s.

books.title: The Master of Ballantrae
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: The relationship of two noble brothers is blighted by hostility and vengeance in Jacobite Scotland.

books.title: The Autobiography of an Idea
books.author: Louis H. Sullivan
books.summary: Famed architect Louis H. Sullivan recounts his life and career.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Beatrix Potter
books.summary: A collection of Beatrix Potter’s short stories for children, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Surprising Adventures of Baron Munchausen
books.author: Rudolph Erich Raspe
books.summary: The legendary Baron Munchausen’s tall tales of wonder and adventure.

books.title: The Merry Wives of Windsor
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Sir John Falstaff runs astray of the denizens of Windsor by trying to seduce several local wives at once.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: A collection of E. M. Forster’s short stories, ordered by date of their original publication.

books.title: The Old Curiosity Shop
books.author: Charles Dickens
books.summary: A girl and her grandfather struggle through a life of poverty amidst a diverse cast of memorable characters in Victorian London.

books.title: The Dark Other
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: A young woman seeks the reason behind her lover’s outbursts of cruelty.

books.title: The Life of Buffalo Bill
books.author: William F. Cody
books.summary: The 1879 autobiography of William F. Cody, more commonly known as Buffalo Bill, detailing his early life in the American West.

books.title: The Man in the Brown Suit
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: Anne Beddingfeld travels to South Africa after finding a cryptic note beside the body of a man whose death she witnessed in the London Underground.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: Moribund Society and Anarchy
books.author: Jean Grave
books.summary: Jean Grave systemically critiques bourgeois society from an anarchist perspective.

books.title: The Nibelungenlied
books.author: Anonymous
books.summary: The epic poem that follows the legendary hero Siegfried on his adventures, his death, and his wife’s revenge.

books.title: Evelina
books.author: Fanny Burney
books.summary: A young woman navigates the absurdities of 18th-century English society, fends off various suitors, and attempts to establish her true parentage.

books.title: Metropolis
books.author: Thea von Harbou
books.summary: In a futuristic dystopian city, the son of the city’s mastermind falls in love with a revolutionary activist.

books.title: Lais
books.author: Marie de France
books.summary: A collection of twelfth-century medieval tales of chivalry and romance.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.
